words.defineEn: to leave the house to go somewhere, usually to do something enjoyable
words.defineVi: rời khỏi nhà để đi đâu đó, thường là để làm điều gì đó thú vị

examples: The manager played his strongest side of the season.
The bedside radio played softly.
The media, as always, played an important part in the election campaign.
Fathers play a crucial role in their children's upbringing and development.
His dedication and hard work played a big part in the company's success.
words.defineEn: to take part in a game or activity for fun
words.defineVi: để tham gia vào một trò chơi hoặc hoạt động cho vui

examples: Does this pub do lunches?
Does this pub do lunches?
Does the price include tax?
Microprocessors do the calculations in the twinkling of an eye.
The gang did a warehouse and a supermarket.
words.defineEn: to perform a particular activity or task
words.defineVi: để thực hiện một hoạt động cụ thể hoặc nhiệm vụ

examples: The Siemens display goes the whole hog.
The cruise went very quickly.
My laptop went haywire
To go swimming/fishing/jogging.
The email went to everyone in the company.
words.defineEn: to travel or move from one location to another location
words.defineVi: để đi du lịch hoặc di chuyển từ một địa điểm đến một địa điểm khác

examples: The store stays open late on Thursdays.
The TV stays on all day in their house.
Stay in touch with your customers via Internet.
Stay in touch with the latest technologies.
Enjoy your stay at our hotel.
words.defineEn: to not move or leave
words.defineVi: không di chuyển hoặc rời đi

examples: A true leader walks the talk.
The old lady walked slowly with the support of her cane.
The father proudly walked his daughter down the aisle on her wedding day.
They walk their dogs every day.
She walked the horse around the ring.
words.defineEn: to move forward at a regular speed by placing our feet in front of each other one by one
words.defineVi: di chuyển về phía trước với tốc độ đều đặn bằng cách đặt chân của chúng ta trước mặt nhau từng cái một

examples: The goldfish in the bowl was swimming around happily.
Swim at your own risk.
I had a swim to cool down.
To go for a ride/drive/run/swim.
You're swimming against the tide regarding thank you letters.
words.defineEn: to move through water by moving parts of the body, especially the limbs
words.defineVi: di chuyển trong nước bằng cách di chuyển các bộ phận của cơ thể, đặc biệt là các chi

examples: The committee meets once a fortnight.
The car met the bus head-on.
He met his death in 1946.
I meet my study group at the library on Tuesday afternoons.
We usually meet at the coffee shop on Fridays.
words.defineEn: to come together in a place with others to do something special
words.defineVi: đến với nhau ở một nơi với những người khác để làm điều gì đó đặc biệt

examples: Let your body relax.
The hot water in the shower helped me relax after a long day.
We spent our vacation relaxing on the sandy beaches by the sea.
You sit down and relax.
As the sun beat down, they relaxed on the beach, sipping on cold beverages with slices of lime rind floating on top.
words.defineEn: to feel less worried or stressed
words.defineVi: để cảm thấy bớt lo lắng hoặc căng thẳng

examples: Travel broadens the mind.
The train traveled through beautiful countryside.
They travelled the highways and byways of Britain.
The news traveled across the country like lightning.
His travels brought him into contact with many famous artists.
words.defineEn: to go from one location to another, particularly to a far location
words.defineVi: đi từ địa điểm này sang địa điểm khác, đặc biệt là đến một địa điểm xa

examples: This book bridges a gulf between the metaphysics literature and philosophy of mind literature.
The book raises many important questions.
Every age has its book, after all.
The movie follows the book faithfully.
The movie follows the book faithfully.
words.defineEn: to arrange and confirm a seat, ticket, room, or place on a transportation, accommodation, or event
words.defineVi: để sắp xếp và xác nhận chỗ ngồi, vé, phòng hoặc địa điểm trên phương tiện giao thông, chỗ ở hoặc sự kiện

examples: Commuters packed like sardines on the evening train.
I packed an extra jacket for the camping trip.
My sister packed some Spanish limes in her picnic basket for a tangy snack on our outdoor adventure.
We packed sandwiches for our picnic in the park.
She packed a small bag of peanuts for her road trip.
words.defineEn: to put clothes and other things needed for travel into a bag, suitcase, etc.
words.defineVi: để quần áo và những thứ khác cần thiết cho chuyến du lịch vào túi xách, vali, v.v.

examples: His partner left the table in a fit of pique.
The spicy beef jerky left a smoky aftertaste in my mouth.
Red wine leaves a stain.
Leaves change colour in autumn.
The intense gaze from across the room, eyes on stalks, left no doubt about his attraction.
words.defineEn: to go away from somewhere or someone
words.defineVi: đi khỏi một nơi nào đó hoặc một ai đó

examples: The truck carried a load of construction materials to the building site.
The judge's ruling carries significant weight in the legal community.
She carries the heavy grocery bags with one arm.
He carries a gym bag with his workout clothes and water bottle.
She carried a heavy load of books in her backpack.
words.defineEn: to hold someone or something and take them from one place to another
words.defineVi: để giữ một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó và đưa họ từ nơi này sang nơi khác

examples: His face wore a puzzled look.
Both men wore confident smiles.
My mom wears facial mask sometmes.
The police officer wears a uniform and a badge.
He wears glasses now.
words.defineEn: to have something such as clothes, shoes, etc. on your body
words.defineVi: để có một cái gì đó như quần áo, giày dép, vv trên cơ thể của bạn

examples: 95 per cent of the UK can now get superfast broadband.
This room gets very little sunshine.
Get a load of that dress Mag!
Get a load of George over there.
The police got wind of the illegal drug deal.
words.defineEn: to use a taxi, bus, train, plane, etc. for transportation
words.defineVi: sử dụng taxi, xe buýt, xe lửa, máy bay, vv để vận chuyển

examples: Your car is waiting, sir.
C'm on the crowd is waiting.
We waited there for the better part of an hour.
What are you waiting for?
Leeds United had waited for success for eighteen years.
words.defineEn: to not leave until a person or thing is ready or present or something happens
words.defineVi: để không rời đi cho đến khi một người hoặc điều đã sẵn sàng hoặc hiện tại hoặc một cái gì đó xảy ra

examples: Rents have gone through the roof.
The rent is coming due next week.
They rented the same bungalow year in, year out.
He rented an expensive sports car for his wedding day.
He rented an apartment in the city to be closer to his workplace.
words.defineEn: (of an owner) to let someone use a property, car, etc. for a particular time
words.defineVi: (của chủ sở hữu) để cho ai đó sử dụng tài sản, xe hơi, v.v. trong một thời gian cụ thể

examples: The slow train arrived at the station behind schedule.
Has the train from Bristol arrived?
The fast train arrived at the destination in no time.
Replies to the advertisement are arriving in fits and starts.
The elevator arrived after a couple of minutes of waiting.
words.defineEn: to reach a location, particularly as an end to a journey
words.defineVi: để đạt được một địa điểm, đặc biệt là kết thúc một cuộc hành trình

examples: Will you get the phone?
Your phone is ringing for the thousandth time.
The phone rang and broke my train of thought.
I have my phone to thank for my lack of sleep last night.
The phone lead isn’t long enough to reach the bedroom.
words.defineEn: to make a phone call or try to reach someone on the phone
words.defineVi: gọi điện thoại hoặc cố gắng liên lạc với ai đó qua điện thoại

examples: My dad bought a stylish suit for his friend's wedding.
The rich man bought a big house and a fancy car.
We bought a bag of coarse sea salt from the specialty store.
She bought an expensive dress for a special occasion.
I bought a pound of fresh meat from the butcher.
words.defineEn: to get something in exchange for paying money
words.defineVi: để có được một cái gì đó để đổi lấy việc trả tiền

examples: The TV quiz was more fun than a barrel of monkeys!
The colorful bowtie pasta added a fun twist to the classic mac and cheese dish.
He sounds about as much fun as a wet weekend in Carmarthenshire.
I had so much fun at the family reunion.
The fans had fun and got their money's worth.
words.defineEn: the feeling of enjoyment or amusement
words.defineVi: cảm giác thích thú hoặc giải trí

examples: Holy moly, this is exciting news!
The company CEO let the employees in on the exciting news about the upcoming merger.
Hockey is an exciting sport played on ice or field, with sticks and a small puck or ball.
Take the initiative and fill your life with exciting experiences.
They claim drag racing is the most exciting motor sport.
words.defineEn: making us feel interested, happy, and energetic
words.defineVi: khiến chúng ta cảm thấy thích thú, hạnh phúc và tràn đầy năng lượng

examples: The policeman hammered home the dangers of drinking and driving.
My son is coming home soon.
The forest is home to a diverse range of plant and animal species.
I pressed the issue home to them.
To hit a home run.
words.defineEn: the place that we live in, usually with our family
words.defineVi: nơi mà chúng tôi sống, thường là với gia đình của chúng tôi

examples: Does this pub do lunches?
He and his fellow workers would incessantly talk shop in the village pub.
He was in the pub drowning his sorrows after the break-up of his relationship.
After the row in a pub he drove off in a huff.
There were a couple of drunkards having a go outside our local pub last night.
words.defineEn: a place where alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks, and often food, are served
words.defineVi: một nơi phục vụ đồ uống có cồn và không cồn, và thường là thức ăn

examples: The supermarket offers a wide variety of dairy products, including milk, cheese, butter, and yogurt.
The gang did a warehouse and a supermarket.
I buy groceries and household items at the supermarket every week.
My father compares prices at different supermarkets to get the best deals.
Shelley drove him to the supermarket.
words.defineEn: a large store that a person can go to and buy food, drinks and other things from
words.defineVi: một cửa hàng lớn mà một người có thể đến và mua thức ăn, đồ uống và những thứ khác từ

words.defineEn: someone who strongly supports, admires, or likes a football team or football in general
words.defineVi: một người ủng hộ mạnh mẽ, ngưỡng mộ, hoặc thích một đội bóng đá hoặc bóng đá nói chung

examples: He would have had a perfect game, except he walked a batter in the final inning.
Mark's friend had passed away, and he found that all things grow with time except grief, as he slowly learned to cope with the loss and cherish the memories they shared.
Trauma surgeons work tirelessly to save lives, but ultimately they realize there is a remedy for everything except death and must accept that some injuries are simply too severe.
We used to say in this country, excepting Vietnam, that the country had never lost a war.
Except, chemical engines also have a pretty big downside.
words.defineEn: not including; other than
words.defineVi: không bao gồm; khác với

examples: My best friend's pink hair definitely raised a few eyebrows at our very strict school.
I definitely felt the importance of the occasion.
You should definitely bake a brie with cranberry sauce.
Speaking that rudely to your teacher definitely crosses the line.
Going to the beach is definitely my scene.
words.defineEn: in a certain or definite way
words.defineVi: theo một cách nhất định hoặc xác định
